description: Define strings S(0)=0, S(1)=11, S(n) = S(n-1)S(n-2); iterate.
links: Reinhard Zumkeller, Table of n, a(n) for n = 0..10000
formula: For n>1, a(n-1)=floor(phi*ceiling(n/phi))-ceiling(phi*floor(n/phi)) where phi=(1+sqrt(5))/2. For n>=0, a(n)=abs(A005713(n+1)). - _Benoit Cloitre_, Apr 21 2003
prog: (PARI) a(n,f1,f2)=local(f3); for(i=3,n,f3=concat(f2,f1); f1=f2; f2=f3); f2(PARI) printp(a(10,[ 0 ],[ 1,1 ])) \\ Would give S(10). Sequence is S(infinity).(Haskell)a005713 n = a005713_list !! na005713_list = 1 : 1 : concat (sibb [0] [1,1]) where   sibb xs ys = zs : sibb ys zs where zs = xs ++ ys-- _Reinhard Zumkeller_, Dec 30 2011
author: _N. J. A. Sloane_.
